title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 162.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 162.2 - Definitions

State Regulations

As used in this Part: (a) Vocational training programs shall mean
noncredit vocational training programs offered by an eligible agency which are
of at least 320 clock hours in length, and which meet standards of
instructional quality prescribed by the commissioner. (b) Eligible agencies shall mean institutions
of higher and professional education, registered private business schools, licensed private schools, and other postsecondary and secondary agencies which
offer vocational training programs and have been approved for funding by the
commissioner. (c) Noncredit
programs shall mean programs for which no credit toward a degree is awarded to
the Vietnam veteran by the institution offering the program. (d) Record of placement of completers shall
mean a record of the number of students completing a vocational training
program and the number who obtain employment directly related to the training
provided. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
162.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
